intro: Psychotria aemulans, commonly known as the "viper's bugloss," is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Psychotria aemulans is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and its use in ornamental horticulture.
